abstract: ABC News icon Barbara Walters played crucial go-between who helped forge relationship between West Coast entertainment mogul David Geffen and Lincoln Center chairwoman Kathrine G Farley that resulted in Geffen's $100 million donation toward renovating Avery Fisher Hall in exchange for naming rights; question remains as to whether Geffen's gift, which amounts to only 20 percent of projected renovation cost, is enough to justify naming rights in perpetuity.
lead_paragraph: Some in the world of cultural philanthropy question whether Mr. Geffen’s gift is large enough to warrant the renaming of a building as prominent as Avery Fisher Hall.

headline.main: How David Geffen’s $100 Million Lincoln Center Gift Came Together
headline.print_headline: Back Story to a Major Cultural Donation

snippet: Some in the world of cultural philanthropy question whether Mr. Geffen’s gift is large enough to warrant the renaming of a building as prominent as Avery Fisher Hall.

keywords.value: Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts
